TypeSignature.Value: .class nested protected auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlSerializationReader/Fixup extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Holds an delegate instance, plus the method's inputs; also serves as the parameter for the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks While deserializing XML documents into .NET Framework objects, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically instantiates fix-up methods that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate; plus, it instantiates <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class objects to store the fix-up methods along with their inputs. The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays whose data types map to .NET Framework reference types. Then, as necessary, a fix-up method is called to fill in the objects in the array.
In addition, during initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization derived from the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> class. During this process, the infrastructure generates <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> properties plus <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class objects for SOAP-encoded, multireferenced XML data. The methods are then invoked during deserialization.
Do not directly create an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.Fixup> class.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of keys for the objects that belong to the property whose values get filled in by the callback implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The objects can be a SOAP-encoded array or items that belong to a Web service method that maps to a SOAP-encoded message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains other objects whose values get filled in by the callback implementation.
Docs.value: The source containing objects with values to fill.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object to fix can be one of the following:
- An array whose items the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate implementation fills in.
- A mapping between a Web service method and a SOAP message that can be defined in a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document. The members of the mapping, such as method parameters, get filled in by the callback method.
